content:
"There is no way I'm giving it to you!"
Turner shouted.
What happened while I was in the other room?

"What is it?"
But Turner did not answer.

I turned my head towards Jones and looked at them. They sighed and told me.
"Well, I think Turner has the cure that I'm looking for, but is refusing to hand it over to me."

"I told you that it is too risky."
"Well, I heard that most of the clinical studies have been finalized."
"That is true, but…!"
Turner clenched their fists and frowned.

"…Nothing changes. I can't give it to you. Every single cure has already been disposed of."
Chris Turner talked in a low voice.
"Disposed of…?"
"That was also the reason why I had to stay."

What did they just say? They disposed of the cure? Then what's this?
I could still feel the glass inside the pocket.

Jones blamed Turner.
"Why did you have to do that, knowing how many people will be saved due to the cure?"
"I said it was because of the risk that-"
"Isn't it because of the experiment without rightful permission?"
Chris Turner looked shocked.

"Well, then it was indeed true. I heard the rumor that one of the subject died because of your experiment. Never knew it was true though."
"That wasn't...!"
"Oh well, if it wasn't a subject, was it a pure civilian?"
Chris Turner glared at Bailey Jones for a few seconds, with their eyes full of hostility, and said.
"Only the chosen ones are allowed to enter the Private Access Area. It's either a researcher or a subject."

"And there is just one type of subject in the Institute of Personality Separation. Those who have dual personalities in one body, and one of which turned into a pure evil and is proven to be a great harm to the society."

"Nobody else other than a few head researchers knows about the cure, because of the secret maintenance agreement."
"……"
"You said the cure could save many lives? Well, I have to tell you that what saves people is not the cure but your evil self being removed forever, Jones."

choices.content: How can I ever believe that?

content: I don't remember seeing anything evil from them.
But what if Turner is telling the truth? Then I cannot hand the cure over to the pure evil.
Who am I going to give the cure to?

choices.content: Hand it over to Bailey Jones
Hand it over to Chris Turner
